node.contents: I am a pig newbie and have been trying to get it running on my Windows 7 machine. My hadoop (2.4.0) works fine on my local machine, but whenever I try to run a simple Pig script, it throws up errors whenever I try to dump the contents of a file.

astNode.text: I am a pig newbie and have been trying to get it running on my Windows 7 machine. My hadoop (2.4.0) works fine on my local machine, but whenever I try to run a simple Pig script, it throws up errors whenever I try to dump the contents of a file.

node.contents: What am I doing wrong here? Am I missing files, or is this configuration issue in build.xml?

astNode.text: What am I doing wrong here? Am I missing files, or is this configuration issue in build.xml?

node.contents: EDIT: I have run this command from both the cmd and cygwin terminal. They both output the same error.

astNode.text: EDIT: I have run this command from both the cmd and cygwin terminal. They both output the same error.

node.contents: FINAL EDIT: Turns out I needed to move the pig src archive (pig-0.12.1-src.tar.gz) to the cygwin home directory, unzip it, cd into the unzipped archive and run the command.

astNode.text: FINAL EDIT: Turns out I needed to move the pig src archive (pig-0.12.1-src.tar.gz) to the cygwin home directory, unzip it, cd into the unzipped archive and run the command.

node.contents: I had the same problem. I solved it by compiling pig via cygwin in my cygwin home.

astNode.text: I had the same problem. I solved it by compiling pig via cygwin in my cygwin home.
